FuncDef: The reset traffic-policy statistics command clears statistics on packets matching a traffic policy. The reset traffic-policy statistics command clears statistics on packets matching a traffic policy.
CLIs: reset traffic-policy statistics { global [ slot <slot-id> ] | interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } | vlan <vlan-id> | vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | qosgroup <group-id> } [ <policy-name> ] [ inbound | outbound ] [ classifier-base <classifier-name> ] [ history ]
reset traffic-policy statistics bridge-domain <bd-id> [ <policy-name> ] [ inbound | outbound ] [ classifier-base <classifier-name> ] [ history ]

reset traffic-policy statistics { global [ slot <slot-id> ] | interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } | vlan <vlan-id> | vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | qosgroup <group-id> } [ <policy-name> ] [ inbound ] [ classifier-base <classifier-name> ] [ history ]

ParaDef.Info:
Clears statistics on packets matching a traffic policy in the system.
-

Specifies a slot ID.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Clears statistics on packets matching a traffic policy on a specified interface. If this parameter is not specified, statistics on packets of all interfaces are cleared.
interface-type specifies the interface type.interface-number specifies the interface number.
-
-
-
For the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ:-
For the CE6885-LL (low latency mode):-

Clears statistics on packets matching a traffic policy applied to a specified interface. If this parameter is not specified, flow-based traffic statistics on all interfaces are cleared.
-

Clears statistics on packets matching a traffic policy in a specified VLAN.
For the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ:The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.
For the CE6885-LL (low latency mode):The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 1023.

Clears the record of a traffic policy that has been applied in a specified VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces. The VPN instance name cannot be _public_. The character string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks ("").

Clears statistics on packets matching a specified traffic policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

Clears traffic statistics in the inbound direction.
-

Clears traffic statistics in the outbound direction.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
-

Clears statistics on packets matching a specified traffic classifier.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, starting with a letter or digit. It cannot contain spaces.

Clears historical packet statistics after a traffic policy is applied.
-

Clears the record of a traffic policy that has been applied in a specified QoS group.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

Clears the record of a traffic policy that has been applied in a BD.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
The bd-id value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset traffic-policy statistics interface 100GE 1/0/1 inbound history
ExtraInfo:
After this command is run, traffic statistics are cleared and cannot be restored.
To view traffic statistics, run the display traffic-policy statistics command.
